page.text: This section provides documentation for the NTgCalls C API, which allows you to use NTgCalls in various programming languages, including C, C++, Go, Rust, Deno, and more. Below, you will find detailed information about the initialization and cleanup functions.
To get started with NTgCalls in your application, you need to initialize the library using the ntg_init function. This function sets up the necessary resources and prepares NTgCalls for use.
page.alert: Make sure to call ntg_init before using any other NTgCalls functions.
page.text: To clean up and release the resources used by NTgCalls, you should call the ntg_destroy function. This function deallocates memory and performs necessary cleanup operations.
page.alert: Always call ntg_destroy when you are done using NTgCalls to prevent memory leaks and resource issues.
page.text: You can retrieve the version of the NTgCalls library currently in use using the ntg_get_version function. This function returns a string containing the version number.

subtext.text: A character buffer to store the version string.
